subject: Medicine
title: The Eradication of Smallpox
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Eradication of Smallpox.

hook.text: Smallpox killed 300 million people in the 20th century alone. In 1980, it was declared eradicated.

buildup.text: A global vaccination campaign targeted every outbreak, vaccinating everyone in a ring around each case.

discovery.text: Ring vaccination works because smallpox spreads slowly and the vaccine provides rapid protection.

twist.text: The last natural case occurred in Somalia in 1977. A lab accident caused the true final death in 1978.

punchline.text: Humanity declared war on a virusâ€”and won.

quiz.question: What strategy was key to eradicating smallpox?
options: Ring vaccination around every detected case
Mass vaccination of entire countries simultaneously
Natural immunity that developed over centuries
